cohort.name: Traye Johnson
cohort.funfact: I'm a huge videogame and anime nerd, and I like to do archery.
cohort.bio: I'm a chill person. A little weird, but I got the spirit. I like to treat others well.

cohort.name: Bryson Goins
cohort.funfact: "Insanity" is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. Some of us also call that "debugging".
cohort.bio: I am a former massage therapist who decided to pursue his lifelong ambition of working in software development. In this field, I can combine my love of technology with my love of puzzles and problem-solving. In my free time, I enjoy motorcycling, gaming, and spending time with my family.

cohort.name: David Darden
cohort.funfact: I am getting married on August 7th.
cohort.bio: I am from Middle Tennessee. I have been a teacher and a soldier. I earned two bachelor's degrees. Now I make computers do some pretty cool things.

cohort.name: Jackson Goodman
cohort.funfact: Humans are the only animals that blush.
cohort.bio: I was born in California and studied filmmaking and journalism for a few years. I have always enjoyed working with computers.

cohort.name: Brandon Hill
cohort.funfact: I am currently writing a book!
cohort.bio: Born and raised in Franklin, TN, I am the the youngest of 7. Growing up I was always drawn to technology and creativity. Writing has always been my way of having a creative outlet, but I can now add coding to that arsenal as well. I try to enjoy the little things in life and appreciate all the beauty that our world has to offer.

cohort.name: Sidney Crandall
cohort.funfact: I was the first baby born in Gallatin, TN on Valentine's Day in 1990.
cohort.bio: I am nerdy individual who loves Doctor Who, anime, manga, and Animal Crossing. I have 3 chihuahuas.  I enjoy making fun and creative websites for users.

cohort.name: Carter Culkin
cohort.capstone: https://github.com/cculkin8/cc-capstone Will add a youtube link later
cohort.funfact: I can be seen nearby Franklin Tennessee on google maps street view.
cohort.bio: As you've probably guessed, my name is Carter, I've been living in Nashville since 2011. During my adult life in the Nashville area I have spent most of my time working in the automotive industry. I decided to leave that industry because I realized an important part of living a happy life is to not mix work and play.

cohort.name: Cody Jones
cohort.funfact: My absolute favorite hobby outside of work is homebrewing! The endless possibilities in crafting the ultimate adult beverage whether it be beer or wine excites me to no end.
cohort.bio:
I am a software engineer that loves deconstructing issues to find solutions to my problems.
Before software development, I have been working in the restaurant service industry for over 9 years. This has helped me build and develop on problem solving skills and management that have lead me to success in my software development career.

cohort.name: B.J. Golden
cohort.funfact: I can play nine different instruments.
cohort.bio: Software developer with a masters degree in classical guitar performance. Dedicated, passionate, and creative professional committed to growth within myself and my team.

cohort.name: Ethan Mathis
cohort.funfact: I've played competitive 9-ball pool for the last 5 years.
cohort.bio: Having done everything from operating heavy machinery, to bartending on Broadway I've decided to start a career in software development and I've never been happier.

cohort.name: Autumn Fotopoulos
cohort.personalwebsite: coming soon- prob next week not finished
cohort.funfact: I was today years old when I found out Goofy is a Cow and not a Dog..
cohort.bio: Hi, I'm Autumn, a retired Stay-at-home-Mom! A quote I've always loved is " The best things come from living outside of your comfort zone", going to Nashville Software School and becoming a software developer was honestly at a similar level to me as receiving my Hogwarts letter. I thought impossible, until learning more about NSS, and the opportunities this career would offer. Surprise! It was the best career choice I have made, software development  has provided me the space to be creative, learn new things, and meet tons of different people from all walks of life. Feel free to reach out anytime, Happy Coding!

cohort.name: Nicholas Patton
cohort.funfact: Chewing gum actually boosts concentration. Hmm... I should probably chew more gum.
cohort.bio: As a lifelong artist, creativity has been the driving force in my life. After years of doing retail and warehouse work, I had a mid pandemic realization that I had owed it to myself to pursue a career that fueled that passion for creativity. I have always been interested in technology, so software seemed like a natural fit, and I haven't looked back. Getting the opportunity to flex those creative and deductive muscles, and learn something new every day, has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my life.

cohort.name: Preston Shotts
cohort.personalwebsite: i will have this up this weekend
cohort.funfact: I can solve over 30 types of Rubiks Cubes
cohort.bio: Creative mind with over ten years of video, graphic design and special effects experience. I'm now jumping into software development to grow even more in the world of computers and automation. I'm looking forward to how I can involve all of my skill sets into future projects!

cohort.name: Dakota Upchurch
cohort.funfact: In a single hour, the amount of power from the sun that strikes the Earth is more than the entire world consumes in a year.
cohort.bio: I'm a former restaurant worker/landscaper turned Software Developer. After years of demanding and physical work I decided I wanted to do something more mentally stimulating. I enjoy coding to solve problems, it challenges me to be more flexible in how I think. I also enjoy gaming with friends, watching movies with my wife, and giving my pets the best life.

cohort.name: Colten Mayberry
cohort.funfact: I was very involved in my school's theater program.  I wrote and starred in my own play.
cohort.bio: After working a variety of jobs by day while treating coding as a hobby, I finally decided to take control of my life and pursue what I loved.  Since taking the plunge at NSS, I have made incredible friends, learned invaluable skills, and discovered that software development is something I'm genuinely, deeply passionate about.  All I want now is to write good code with good people.

cohort.name: Laurel Morrison
cohort.funfact: I have never had mashed potatoes.
cohort.bio: Recently making the jump from working in project/account management at advertising agencies to software development. I'm hoping to combine my love of process and creativity, with the constantly evolving world of code. I have always enjoyed breaking things down, now i'm ready to create.

cohort.name: Logan Demmy
cohort.funfact: My first motorcycle was a bit of an impulse purchase, I got it home in boxes in the back of my Subaru. It only took 3 years to get up and running.
cohort.bio: Studying software development, with a background in marketing and hospitality management. Throughout my hospitality career I have been interested in problem solving, learning, and cultivating the businesses I have managed. After nearly 15 years, and multiple countries I am transitioning to full stack development where I can continue to challenge myself as well as continue to cultivate my many strengths.

cohort.name: Joel Gage
cohort.funfact: I was once fined a large sum of money at Carnegie Hall for taking pictures when I should not have been. Luckily, I was able to get it resolved...
cohort.bio: Born in St. Louis, raised in Alabama, in a family of all Tennessee natives, I now have happily called Nashville my home for over 10 years. My time in Nashville has been spent in a career as a freelance Musician, filled with awesome opportunities to travel all over the continental U.S. and the world. Currently, I am adventuring into the new (to me) world of Software Development and am excited about what the future may bring!

cohort.name: Salma Crank
cohort.personalwebsite: https://srcrank.github.io/ (Not live yet but will be here)
cohort.funfact: My parents used to confiscate my books when I would get in trouble as a kid.
cohort.bio: Following my graduation from undergrad, I decided to explore new career options and further my education through software development. I have discovered new passions in pursuing a career in tech, and am enthusiastic about this new direction. I enjoy solving problems and collaborating with others, and have enjoyed applying this through software development.

cohort.name: Alex Dudley
cohort.funfact: I've traveled to 30 different countries on 5 continents and have never been to Florida.
cohort.bio: I am a military veteran, photographer, world traveler, and former bartender who has recently made the transition to software development. I've always prided myself in my attention to detail and work ethic and look forward to starting a new career as a software developer!

cohort.name: Jeremiah Schugt
cohort.funfact: Raspberry Pi's are not food!
cohort.bio: Started coding using QBasic, back in the day. I've been interested in how programs work, taking on their challenges and the satisfaction of solving and learning.

cohort.name: Brandon P Vinson
cohort.funfact: Won the bronze medal in a state disc golf competition.
cohort.bio: Spending the last two decades in the restaurant business, I really learned the value of team work and serving others. I want to take those skills into the world of software development to serve others on a broader scale.

cohort.name: Bre Coach
cohort.funfact: I have a meme album on my phone, inspired by Michael Scott and Kanye. This really is an amazing time to be alive.
cohort.bio: After working in banking wire operations for some time, I decided to take a leap and pursue software development! I needed some excitement, an outlet to express my creativity, and a role that enabled me to learn something new everyday.. and pay a few bills. On top of developing outstanding software, I'm a pretty chill, very funny thanks to 'The Office', and can cry on command. I welcome all opportunities to showcase any one of those skills!

cohort.name: Hunter Preast
cohort.funfact: Nothing gives me quite so much joy as when people tell me they've had their pets spayed or neutered
cohort.bio: I went to a four year university straight out of high school and absolutely hated it. After spending some time off, I was told about NSS and decided to give it a shot, since then I have enjoyed every second of it and each challenge that they have thrown at me. I know I've grown a lot in this short time and I'm ready to keep improving.

cohort.name: Chad Clark
cohort.funfact: I have Phished all over the U.S. and love to canoe in Canada. Oh and...'Music is the Best' - FrankZappa.
cohort.bio: A recent convert to Full Stack Development after twenty five years of technical work in Nashville area Studios and Concert Support. I have gone from analog board level electronics to CMOS, to digital and beyond. My thirst for knowledge is unquenchable. I have an incredible wife and son, and a very supportive family. I love to get out in nature and renew.

cohort.name: Micaela Colpi
cohort.personalwebsite: I will get this to you asap
cohort.funfact: The green code in The Matrix was actually created from symbols in the code designer’s wife’s sushi cookbook.
cohort.bio: After graduating in 2019 and getting my cosmetology license, I decided to do hair full time. It was amazing until the pandemic started, and then I was unemployed for three months. This really got me thinking about other career opportunities, and thankfully I stumbled upon Nashville Software School. Applying to NSS was one of the best decisions of my life and every day in class reminds me of this. I am so exited to start my career as a Software Developer,

cohort.name: Taryn Lytle
cohort.funfact: I have a pug named Gus that hasn't paid rent in 7 years.
cohort.bio: I am an ex-axe throwing general manager who decided to holster my hatchets in order to embark on a new career in web development. I have enjoyed building reliable, attentive teams and creating a positive environment for customers to enjoy and am looking forward to combining my past experience with my new found skills in the technology world. Every day that goes by of learning, reassures me that I have made the best possible decision for my future.

cohort.name: Chris Douglass
cohort.funfact: I once was given a ride around the Miami Sea Aquarium on the back of Flipper(one of many Flippers)
cohort.bio: My name is Chris Douglass; I have been a software engineer for 12 years. After an employee decided to relocate their entire software team, I decided to attend NSS to learn better front-end skills. I enjoy solving problems and using technology to make tasks easier. When I am not coding I enjoy spending time with my son and wife.

cohort.name: Meg McGregor
cohort.funfact: Orcas are my favorite animal because they're communicative, social, and playful. I want to say that they're my spirit animal, but I can't take credit for their magnificence.
cohort.bio: I have a background in visual art and retail. After years of managing a small business, I saw how the right software can help a business thrive and web development sparked my interest. For me, coding is a fantastic mashup of creative and highly-technical work.
